Free Meals For Students

On August 31, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Food and Nutrition Services announced nationwide waivers and extensions to the National School Lunch Program (NSLP). These waivers and extensions will be through December 31, 2020 or until the funding runs out.

Effective Tuesday, September 8 the Wheelersburg Local Schools will provide a FREE breakfast and a FREE lunch to each student while the NSLP waivers and extensions last. The cafeteria will still offer a la carte items for purchase. In addition, each student will be offered a FREE breakfast and FREE lunch package during dismissal time to take home for the following day. Students who are attending school 100% on-line are eligible for this FREE program and may arrange curb-side pick-up of their meals at school.

If you have any questions please contact Brenda Spires, Food Service Director, at 574-0462 or brenda.spires@wheelersburg.net.

Public Notification - Kdg & 1st Grade Parents

The Wheelersburg Schools is required to provide this public notification to parents of incoming kindergarten or first grade students for the 2019-2020 school year. Please read the following information. Please contact Wheelersburg Elementary School at 574-8130 if you have any questions.

Board Policy, Physical Examinations of Students - The District screens students for hearing, vision, speech and communications, and health or medical problems and for any developmental disorders prior to November 1 of the school year in which a pupil is enrolled for the first time in either kindergarten or first grade in a manner determined by the Board. The District notifies parents prior to August 1 of the year in which the pupil is required to be screened and gives parents the opportunity to submit a written statement excluding their children. If the results of any screening reveal the possibility of special learning needs, the District conducts further assessment in accordance with State law.

March 1, 2018

Dear Parents,

I would like to convey to you and the community that the Wheelersburg Schools continuously monitors our school environment to insure the safety of our students and staff. We strive each day to provide a safe, caring and nurturing learning environment in order that our students may thrive socially, emotionally and academically.

In order to insure students and staff may focus on teaching and learning and to help alleviate any anxiety all of us may be feeling, the Board of Education has authorized me to contract with the Scioto County Sheriff's office for an off-duty deputy to be present during school hours. The deputy will be in uniform and highly visible. The deputy will be present as much as possible for the remainder of the school year.

Please be assured, the Board of Education and administration will continue to evaluate and monitor our current safety and security practices.

Respectfully,

Mark Knapp, Superintendent
